Package com.atakmap.spatial

Class SpatialCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.spatial.SpatialCalculator
  • public final class SpatialCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Spatial calculator backed by SpatiaLite. The calculator will require both memory and disk resources. It is recommended that the dispose() method be invoked when the calculator will no longer be used to immediately release all allocated resources. In the event that dispose() is not explicitly invoked, the resources will be released on finalization.

    Workflow

    The general workflow for the calculator will be to create geometries in the calculator's memory and then perform various spatial operations on those geometries. When a geometry is created, a handle to that geometry in the calculator's memory is returned. The geometry may be accessed (e.g. used as an argument to a function) via the memory handle. The calculator's memory may be cleared at any time by invoking the method, clear(). When the memory is cleared all existing geometries handles are invalidated. Attempting to use an invalid handle will produce undefined results.

    The calculator makes use of two mechanisms to improve performance. The first mechanism is caching. Data structures and instructions are cached to reduce general overhead. The user may clear the cache at any time by invoking the method, clearCache(). If a reference to the calculator is going to be maintained for a long time but its use is infrequent it may be appropriate to clear the cache between uses. The second mechanism is batching. Batching instructs the calculator to perform all instructions without performing an actual commit to the calculator memory until the batch has been completed. This can significantly improve performance when instructions are being executed in high volume or frequency. All instructions given to the calculator within the batch will produce valid results, however, all instructions issued during the batch are not actually committed to the calculator's memory until endBatch(boolean) is invoked. If endBatch(boolean) is invoked with an argument of false all instructions issued during the batch are undone and the calculator is in the same state as it was prior to the batch.

    Thread Safety

    This class is NOT thread-safe. Care needs to be taken to ensure that methods are invoked in a thread-safe manner. It is strongly recommended that each instance only be used on a single thread.

    Special care must be taken when the calculator is in batch mode. When in batch mode, instructions may only be issued to the calculator on the thread that the batch was started in.

    • Method Detail

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears the calculator instruction cache.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes the calculator. All allocated resources are released. Any use of the calculator following an invocation of this method will produce undefined results.

      • isDisposed

        public boolean isDisposed()
        Calling any method on this calculator after dispose() has been called will lead to undefined behavior.

        It is recommended that you check for !calc.isDisposed() before making any calls.

        Returns:
        true if this calculator has had its dispose() method called, or if it is in the middle of initializing i.e. init() has not returned. Returns false otherwise.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the calculator's memory. Any previously obtained geometry handles must be considered invalid.

      • beginBatch

        public void beginBatch()
        Begins an instruction batch. The calculator will not actually commit any instructions issued to memory until the batch is completed via endBatch(boolean). During the batch, any created or modified handles will reside in a special volatile memory available to all functions. If the batch is ended successfully, the contents of the volatile memory will be merged with the calculator's memory, otherwise the volatile memory will be released effectively undoing all instructions issued during the batch.

        Once a batch is started, instructions may only be issued to the calculator on the thread that the batch was started on.

      • endBatch

        public void endBatch​(boolean commit)
        Ends the current batch. If commit is true all instructions issued during the batch are committed to the calculator's memory.
        Parameters:
        commit - true to commit the batch instructions, false to undo.

      • createPoint

        public long createPoint​(GeoPoint point)
        Creates a new point in the calculator's memory.

        If 3D Point features are enabled, check if the altitude information by point.isAltitudeValid().

        If it is valid, allow that data to pass through. Otherwise, set it to 0.0d (clamped to the ground) by default.

        Parameters:
        point - A GeoPoint instance to create a feature Point from
        Returns:
        A handle to the point created in the calculator's memory.

      • createPoint

        public long createPoint​(Point point)
        Creates a new point in the calculator's memory.

        If 3D Point features are enabled, a 3D point feature will be created.

        This method does not make any attempt to determine the validity of the Z field.

        Parameters:
        point - A Point feature instance to copy
        Returns:
        A handle to the point created in the calculator's memory.

      • intersection

        public long intersection​(long geom1,
                         long geom2)
        Returns the intersection of the specified geometries as a new geometry in the calculator's memory.
        Parameters:
        geom1 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        geom2 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        Returns:
        A handle to the new geometry that is the intersection of the specified geometries.

      • intersection

        public void intersection​(long geom1,
                         long geom2,
                         long result)
        Performs the intersection operation on the specified geometries and stores the result in the specified memory location. This method may perform significantly faster than intersection(long, long).
        Parameters:
        geom1 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        geom2 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        result - The memory location to store the intersection result. this location must already exist. The same value as geom1 or geom2 may be specified in which case the old geometry will be overwritten with the result.

      • union

        geom2 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        Returns:
        A handle to the new geometry that is the union of the specified geometries.

      • union

        public void union​(long geom1,
                  long geom2,
                  long result)
        Performs the union operation on the specified geometries and stores the result in the specified memory location. This method may perform significantly faster than union(long, long).
        Parameters:
        geom1 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        geom2 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        result - The memory location to store the union result. This location must already exist. The same value as geom1 or geom2 may be specified in which case the old geometry will be overwritten with the result.

      • unionWithBuffer

        public void unionWithBuffer​(long geom1,
                            long geom2,
                            double dist,
                            long result)
        Performs the union operation on the specified geometries and stores the result in the specified memory location. Before the union is performed, both geometries will be buffered as if the buffer(long, double, long) method was called.
        Parameters:
        geom1 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        geom2 - A handle to the geometry in the calculator's memory
        dist - The buffer distance, in degrees
        result - The memory location to store the union result. This location must already exist. The same value as geom1 or geom2 may be specified in which case the old geometry will be overwritten with the result.

      • simplify

        public long simplify​(long handle,
                     double tolerance,
                     boolean preserveTopology)
        Returns the simplification of the specified geometry as a new geometry in the calculator's memory.
        Parameters:
        handle - A handle to the geometry to be simplified
        tolerance - The simplification tolerance, in degrees
        preserveTopology - true to preserve topology, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A handle to the new geometry that is the simplification of the specified geometry.

      • simplify

        public void simplify​(long handle,
                     double tolerance,
                     boolean preserveTopology,
                     long result)
        Performs the simplification operation on the specified geometry and stores the result in the specified memory location. This method may perform significantly faster than simplify(long, double, boolean).
        Parameters:
        handle - A handle to the geometry to be simplified
        tolerance - The buffer distance, in degrees
        preserveTopology - true to preserve topology, false otherwise.
        result - The memory location to store the simplification of handle. This location must already exist. The same value as handle may be specified in which case the old geometry will be overwritten with the result.
